poem:
"Superhero Moments"

In Odaiba, on streets sketched by moonlight,
Ken Sato battles parenthood, a monstrous feat.
Kaiju echoes his father's thrill, 
Yet baby-burps replace buildings' crumbling defeat.
A shout of Godzilla! - once fear,
now lies hushed in a lullaby beat.
In fatherhood, he finds his grand heroism,
the might of love his truest feat.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ultraman: Rising review – endearing kaiju animation battles the monster that is parenting In this family superhero animation with a twist, the monster that must be grappled with by our hero is parenthood – and specifically baby-care. We open in Odaiba, Japan, with a flashback to the childhood of Ken Sato, whose dad is passionate about kaiju, the giant monsters of Japanese pop culture (of which Godzilla is probably the best known in the west).". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Ultraman: Rising review – endearing kaiju animation battles the monster that is parenting In this family superhero animation with a twist, the monster that must be grappled with by our hero is parenthood – and specifically baby-care. We open in Odaiba, Japan, with a flashback to the childhood of Ken Sato, whose dad is passionate about kaiju, the giant monsters of Japanese pop culture (of which Godzilla is probably the best known in the west).
